name: Chelidonia Villas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Chelidona Villas for 4 days in August. The hotel is built into the hillside in Oia, which has to be one of the most beautiful places on earth. The hotel itself is gorgeous, with a view from our own villa that was to die for. It was hard to leave the hotel, because we thoroughly enjoyed sitting on our balcony and drinking wine.
reviews.title: Once in a lifetime experience - We fell in love with this enchanting place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We arrived at the airport and the taxi that Chelidonia had arranged was waiting. The owner, Triantafyllos, greeted us. His family has owned the propeerty for decades and we really enjoyed our time with him and learning more about the history of the island. Our villa was fantastic. It was meticulously clean, had a large patio facing the Caldera, kitchenette in our room, very comfortable beds and linens, and free wifi. Service was excellent and helped us arrange tours, RV rental, and dinner reservations. Every detail was taken care of. The villas were very centrally located in Oia with all the restaurants and shops within steps. There was no swimming pool, but we preferred that as we visited many of Santorni's beaches. There are beaches within walking distance and the water was incredible.
reviews.title: Beautiful Views Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As an example of the tremendous service, our flight out was to leave at 10pm, nearly 11 hours after check out. Triantafyllos arranged for us to shower and rest at his own villa before our flight, so we could still enjoy the full day in Santorini. He went above and beyond to make our trip and experience wonderful.
reviews.title: Stunning view, authentic vibe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travel extensively, and this place ranks at the top of our list of places to stay. If you want a perfect vacation to an enchanted place, this is it! We will definitely be back!
reviews.title: The most beautiful and perfect place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: My Son and I stayed at Chelidonia Villas for a week this August. The most perfect location In Oia, wonderful and comfortable villas and the loveliest host family. Highly reccommend!!
reviews.title: Charming villas with a fantastic view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our stay at Chelidonia Villas was the stuff of fantasy. The villas are beautifully restored; our spacious 2 bedroomed apartment, with living area & kitchen, was a cool haven. The view from our terrace to the Caldera was picture postcard perfect. It was hard to drag ourselves away - in fact, we ate in most nights! A wonderful host who made us feel very welcome from the moment we arrived & the taxi was waiting.
reviews.title: Living in a Postcard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the start, we were met at the port of Thira by a very efficient taxi-van driver, who took us directly to Oia... a thirty minute ride, over the tops of the Santorini cliffs. We were met by a very able porter, who deftly delivered our heavy baggage to our accommodations, 82 steps down the cliff-side, and by "Rose", the owner/proprietor of the Chelidonia Villas. Thus began a seven day adventure that dreams are truly made of. Rose welcomed us with a fine bottle of Domaine Sigalas Assyrtiko white wine in the refrigerator, sweet green grapes, and a very pungent blend of imported German coffee in the kitchen, for the next weeks worth of breakfasts... we provided the Greek yogurt, bananas, peaches and honey from the market down the street. Next to the market is the bakery featuring a vast array of home made breads, cakes, sweets, and the best baklava that anyone could imagine. Our traditional cave-villa was cozy, clean and very comfortable: a living/sitting/dining room, fair-sized bedroom with a very comfortable bed, large bathroom with enclosed stand-up shower, and a small step-down kitchenette. Throughout were antique wooden furnishings: desk, wardrobe, bureau, along with several unique lamps, lighting fixtures, candles and lanterns... very romantic! The daytime heat was pretty intense, especially the afternoons (90 - 95 degrees Fahrenheit) but the air-conditioning was well up to the task. Nights were about 20 degrees cooler and we slept wonderfully. Views from our private patio were stunning... a jaw-dropping vista of cobalt-blue water and boats of all shapes and sizes, with the cliffs of Thira/Fira rising beyond and far above the caldera. Rose was very helpful to offer his suggestions of favorite restaurants (1800, Ambrosia, Roka) and local sites of interest (Domaine Sigalas Winery). His wife, Erika, was especially attentive to the details of booking our stay and in arranging our transfer to Chelidonia from the port where we had arrived by ferry. They made it easy for us upon departure as well... a porter lugged the bags (again up 82 steps) and a taxi-van was on-time at 5:30AM sharp, for a twenty minute trip to the airport. Oia is heaven on earth and we really hated to leave, but we promise to return... to Chelidonia!! Next time, two weeks!!!
reviews.title: The most incredible vacation... ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: There is no better way to describe this beautiful villa. Mr Rose arranged for the airport transfer and explained the working of various things in the house. Which made us feel very welcome.
reviews.title: Amazing amazing amazing!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The villa itself was very cozy and comfortable. It has 2 comfortable bedrooms, a small but clean bathroom and a very pretty kitchenette, which had a hot plate, a coffee maker, a fridge and all possible crockery and cutlery one can use. There was also coffee and sugar. A small red painted window from which the view outside was to die for!! There are pretty crochet white curtains adding to the pretty decor. And loads of books to read, much to the delight of my daughter.
reviews.title: This was the Highlight of our Holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room service was very good. We found the beds neatly made, the bathroom cleaned, mats and towels changed and dishes washed on each day when we returned.
reviews.title: Stunning location but lots of stairs!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chelidonia began with infinite promise. Oia is a picturesque town that inspires awe and surrounds you with stunning vistas and sunsets. Our villa was clean and comfortable (inside).
reviews.title: Steep climb, unbearable heat, smelly nights and rude owner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the temperature on Santorini reached a high of 81 degrees F (27 C), the temperature on the patio was above 100F (38C) until 15:00 each day. We attempted to enjoy breakfast or cocktails but were overwhelmed by the heat. The evenings were beautiful, but the sewer pipe for our unit drained approximately 15 feet below the unit. We could hear every flush and smell every detail of guests of Chelidonia’s bathroom conquests. The first 4 nights there was no breeze and the smell was occasional. On our fifth evening, the breeze upward from the Mediterranean was constant and so was the overwhelming stench.
reviews.title: Perfect stay in Oia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the unexpected factors that you should be aware of is the difficulty of making the climb in and out of the villas in such intense heat. While we went to Santorini for a relaxing and romantic honeymoon, we found ourselves planning most of our days around ways we could come and go from Chelidonia only once--packing packs for beachware, dinner, etc.--to save ourselves from soaking our clothes through with perspiration and generally feeling fatigued before breakfast. Beaches are not accessible to this location (or anywhere in Oia) and take extensive planning - we felt very lucky to have hired a car and wouldn't recommend staying in Oia without one.
reviews.title: The Perfect View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Considering we are on our honeymoon, we made the decision to checkout two nights early so we could stay somewhere that we could fully enjoy. We informed the proprietor of our experience and were met with an unfortunate response. The owner admitted that there was a problem with a pump two days ago but that the problem had been resolved immediately after it was discovered and he assured us that we did not smell what we insisted we had. He proceeded along this path for about 30 minutes going as far as asking another guest that stayed at least 40ft higher on the hill and essentially called us liars; and also informed us that these smells are "normal all over the world" implying that we were spoiled or had unreasonable expectations. In all our travels, not even Tijuana compared with the stench we encountered. At no point did we request a refund, I asked him to do what he thought was right. We were refunded only one of the two nights, and only after a very uncomfortable interaction.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Skip Chelidonia and find somewhere with less press. If you do stay there, do not visit the recommended restaurants. They were the worst we visited as confirmed by other posts on this site.
reviews.title: Adorable villas!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chelidonia Villas is a wonderful, romantic way to end a busy three week trip throughout Greece. The traditional cave rooms are beautiful, romantic retreats.We stayed in the Katerina room....perfect for two with kitchenette that we used every day.The sunrise and sunset are magical. That is why we saw many of the guests retreating to their private patios each day with local bakery products, wine and cheese in hand. Rose, the proud owner is there to help you find what you need and to ensure that your home away form home is clean, comfortable and well cared for. He also gives wonderful recommendations for shopping and dining.He is a charming man who shares his passion for his country.Spending time talking to the people of this incredible town of Oia is an important part of this experience. Erika, also owner, who we arranged our accommodations with was extremely prompt in her responses and takes the extra step to ensure that you have the transportation that you need and the room that is right for you. You will take back home with you special memories of this picturesque town and the caldera. You will also remember the owners and the warm, genuine people who bring
reviews.title: A perfect way to end our trip to Greece

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: life to Oia.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: Three of us stayed at Chelidonia Villas in September 2011 in Villa XL, which had a living room with kitchenette, two bedrooms, bathroom and terrace with superb views over the caldera. Rose the owner arranged for a pickup at the airport and for a porter to bring our luggage down to the villa (which fortunately was only down one flight of steps from Oia’s main street). The rooms were beautifully furnished and cleaned daily. Rose was very helpful and welcomed us with a chilled bottle of white Santorini wine. The only criticism I had was that at night I could hear table and chairs being moved in the restaurant directly above one of the bedrooms, but this was easily remedied with a pair of earplugs. We enjoyed our stay immensely and would thoroughly recommend Chelidonia Villas.
reviews.title: Wow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you are looking for a spectacular setting, privacy, romance, and renewal, you cannot do better than this. Our private villa had plenty of room, a kitchen, and a patio that overlooked the caldera. The owner was very helpful in recommending restaurants and arranging transport to and from the airport.
reviews.title: Amazing view, beautiful village

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you come to Santorini, don't let yourself be fooled by the ugly high rise hotel towers in Thira and similar placed. The village of Oia in the north is truly beautiful. The Chelidonia Villas are spread over this great, car free village that is nestled on the hill far above the ocean. Rund by an Austrian-Greek couple they are true heroes of hospitality. Sure, at prices from 160 to 350 Euro a night (for 2 people) the Chelidonia Villas are not the cheapest option, but you get high quality accomodation, good service and an amazing view over the Caldera. A unique experience! Plus the hosts have very good connections in the community, so they gave us good tips without trying to screw us or earn commissions or thelike.
reviews.title: UNBELIEVABLE, This hotel is a postcard.

description: Chelidonia is a family run set of carefully restaurated traditional dwellings on the caldera cliffs in the heart of Oia, Santorini. We offer panorama and privacy for individual travellers who contact us directly. We are proud to have been recommended by the New York Times as the preferable accommodation to stay on Santorini island.
